summary: Stanley David Levison is mentioned in the context of FBI investigations and responses to Congressional committee requests, particularly the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). The documents highlight his connection to Martin Luther King Jr. and alleged Communist ties, which were subjects of FBI scrutiny from 1962-1975. The FBI provided information about Levison to the SSC, including details obtained from informants. The documents suggest that Levison's associations were a matter of interest to the FBI and Congress during this period, leading to inquiries and information sharing.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: Stanley David Levison's significance in the JFK context, based on these documents, is primarily related to his association with Martin Luther King Jr. and alleged Communist ties, which were investigated by the FBI and brought to the attention of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities. While the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, they indicate that his activities and associations were under surveillance and scrutiny during the period relevant to the assassination investigation.
